nodes.text: An IoT based home automation system can provide low cost, wireless remote control of household appliances, increase energy efficiency and accessibility, and be scalable and secure
Design and implementation approach uses an Android client app communicating via sockets to a microcontroller-based prototype to control appliances over WiFi
Prototype hardware and software components include Arduino UNO R3, Bluetooth module HC-05, relay module, PCB, power supply, WiFi, Arduino IDE and a server
User interface supports two control modes: switch mode sending radio button state, and voice mode using smartphone microphone with Google voice intent to obtain and parse string commands
The system objective includes ability to view device status in the app, control from any WiFi capable device, provide voice and switch control, and be highly scalable to add devices and features
Android phone acts as client and sends user commands via socket programming to the system
Control communications are carried out over secure channels using SSL over TCP or SSH
The prototype implements a wireless remote switching system using WiFi and relay modules to toggle appliances
Switch mode in the app allows toggling appliance states via radio button commands
Voice mode enables appliance control by parsing voice-to-text strings from Google servers and executing parsed commands
The prototype displays status of each device in the smartphone application and is controllable from any WiFi connected device
Prototype achieved an indoor WiFi control range of approximately 150 feet and supports remote switching via the smartphone app and voice commands
The developed prototype is economical, simple in design, easy to extend to various appliances, and suitable for homes, small offices, and shopping centers
Home automation systems can improve energy efficiency and accessibility for elderly and people with disabilities but adoption is limited by complexity and cost
Given the prototype is low cost, WiFi based, and scalable, it can address some accessibility and energy waste problems caused by users forgetting to turn off devices
